name: cnfldhaus

stmt.origin: ax-mp(wcel(c0, cha), wcel(ccom(cabs, cmin), cfv(cxmet, cc)))

body.origin:
|- wcel(c0, cha)
-| wcel(ccom(cabs, cmin), cfv(cxmet, cc))
-| wi(wcel(ccom(cabs, cmin), cfv(cxmet, cc)), wcel(c0, cha))
body.pretty:
⊢ c0 ∈ Haus
⊣ (abs ∘ -)∈(*Met ` ℂ)
⊣ ((abs ∘ -)∈(*Met ` ℂ)→ c0 ∈ Haus)

cumulated.origin:
|- wcel(c0, cha)
-| wcel(ccom(cabs, cmin), cfv(cxmet, cc))
-| wi(wcel(ccom(cabs, cmin), cfv(cxmet, cc)), wcel(c0, cha))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ c0 ∈ Haus
⊣ (abs ∘ -)∈(*Met ` ℂ)
⊣ ((abs ∘ -)∈(*Met ` ℂ)→ c0 ∈ Haus)

cumulated.origin:
|- wcel(c0, cha)
-| wi(wcel(ccom(cabs, cmin), cfv(cxmet, cc)), wcel(c0, cha))

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(ccom(cabs, cmin), cfv(cxmet, cc)), wcel(c0, cha))
-| wceq(c0, cfv(cmopn, ccom(cabs, cmin)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wcel(c0, cha)
-| wceq(c0, cfv(cmopn, ccom(cabs, cmin)))

body.origin:
|- wceq(c0, cfv(cmopn, ccom(cabs, cmin)))
-| wceq(c0, cfv(ctopn, ccnfld))

comment: The topology of the complex numbers is Hausdorff. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Sep-2015.)
